subsc: Sub-national government administration,Central government administration,Secondary education,Tertiary education,Primary education

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Basic Education
            Project is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as substantial, Bank
            performance as highly satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            as satisfactory. Three external factors had a substantial
            impact on project implementation: 1) the earthquake of April
            22, 1991; 2) the economic recession during 1995-1997, and 3)
            the contesting of contract awards by outside bidders. There
            are several lessons that can be learned from the project
            experience: Integration of quality education subcomponents
            require intensive coordination and additional implementation
            time. Public-private sector alliances increase project
            implementation capacity and effectiveness. Continuity of
            project implementing personnel is key to maintain
            satisfactory project execution, especially during and after
            changes in Government administration. Supervision and
            technical assistance must combine sectoral and
            administrative issues. To guarantee development objectives,
            projects must adapt to the changing needs of the education sector.
